poemName: I saw you at 5:03 on Persely Road

children.content: A road with two exits (or enterances),
one out and one in. I am a receptor, inspector
of this road. And I swear I did not hear no
shouts or no din, but you emerged with a devlish
grin, like some schitzo with no empathy within, or
So tell me what happened on persely road?
One enterance, one exit, a whole lifetime between.
Because it is now 5:13 and that poor dog there
Once loved, now in a pool of blood and it's incredibly
sus, there's a fine line through it's head so it couldn't
be the 6:05 bus, and on your bike wheels there's a
hell's sea amount of goo, and there's red on your shoe, so it has
to be new, and you're the only person who went down this road,
